attributes.action: More funding of food for Children in Poverty
attributes.additional_details:
Post 2008 there was austerity which led to a lack of funding for certain welfare and community projects. Post Covid we have seen UNICEF begin food handouts in London, as well as 52% of children in Newham below the poverty line.

If we can afford the furlough scheme and the other covid spending policies then we can implement a scheme for more food for those in poverty. At a fraction of the cost and something with a clear return on investment.
attributes.background: We would like funding for food and deliveries for such food in certain communities. Funding should be in the £100,000's per annum for each local authortiy as well as volunteers for the distribution. Hunger should be eliminated in the UK as well as the strain on Food Banks.
